name: The Islamic Association of Arabi
mission: PROVIDED RELIGOUS SERVICE AND EDUCATION FOR CHILDREN.BENNETT SUPPORT FOR THE NEEDY BY USE OF ZAKAT MINISTRY.WEDDING AND FUNERAL SERVICE.
theoryOfChange: Provides places of worship, Islamic education (including Quran memorization and scholar training), and dawah/community programs to develop scholars/Imams who can serve Muslim communities and convey Islam clearly in the American context.

dimension_explanations.alignment: With a score of 23/50, the charity shows medium alignment for Muslim donors seeking to support religious and cultural preservation [2][6]. The organization facilitates community giving through sadaqah to support its various ministries and educational programs [5][6].
dimension_explanations.impact: The organization demonstrates a capacity-building focus through its educational academies and community support services [1][4]. While financial health is robust with a 96.1% program expense ratio, the lack of third-party impact verification results in a score of 20/50 [1][7].

The organization operates the Al-Hameed Boys Academy and the Amatur Rahman Girls Academy to foster spiritual and academic growth [4][5].

strengths.detail: The organization directs <cite id="6">96.1% of its expenses toward programs</cite>, significantly exceeding the <cite id="9">peer program ratio median of 89.6%</cite>.
The charity has achieved a <cite id="10">3-year revenue CAGR of 42.3%</cite> and maintains <cite id="11">38.8 months of working capital</cite>, ensuring long-term operational stability.
The association operates with <cite id="7">$0.00 spent on fundraising for every $1 raised</cite>, maximizing the impact of community contributions.

strengths_deep_dive: The Islamic Association of Arabi exhibits a rare level of financial efficiency for an established institution. With <cite id="1">over 40 years of operation</cite>, it has managed to scale its revenue to <cite id="5">over $2.3 million</cite> while maintaining a <cite id="6">96.1% program expense ratio</cite>. This indicates that administrative and fundraising costs are likely absorbed by volunteers or specific endowments, allowing public donations to flow directly into its <cite id="2">academies and dawah work</cite>. Furthermore, its <cite id="12">96.1% independent board</cite> provides a foundation for oversight, though the small size of the board remains a point of development.
rich_narrative.summary: Founded in <cite id="1">1985</cite>, the Islamic Association of Arabi (Masjid Yaseen) serves as a central hub for religious education and community services in its region. The organization maintains a robust educational infrastructure, operating the <cite id="2">Al-Hameed Boys Academy and the Amatur Rahman Girls Academy</cite>, alongside Sunday and after-school Maktab programs. Beyond its primary focus on <cite id="3">religious services and education for children</cite>, the association provides critical social support, including <cite id="4">wedding and funeral services</cite> and assistance for the needy. Financially, the organization demonstrated significant scale in 2023, reporting <cite id="5">$2,357,167 in total revenue</cite>. A defining characteristic of its fiscal management is its extreme leaness; the charity reported a <cite id="6">96.1% program expense ratio</cite>, indicating that every dollar of functional expense was directed toward its core mission. This efficiency is further highlighted by its <cite id="7">fundraising efficiency of $0.00 spent per $1 raised</cite>, suggesting that the organization relies on organic community support rather than paid solicitation. While the organization holds substantial <cite id="8">net assets of $5,882,255</cite>, its governance structure remains highly centralized, which is a key factor in its current evaluation profile.
